thread.title: Snohomish streets left in dark after $12,000 copper wire theft
thread.title_full: Snohomish streets left in dark after $12,000 copper wire theft | www.kirotv.com

author: kirotv.com
title: Snohomish streets left in dark after $12,000 copper wire theft
text:
Multiple neighborhoods and streets in Snohomish were left in the dark after thieves stole about $12,000 worth of copper wire in two locations.
Snohomish County Public Works was alerted to the theft after a resident wanted to know why the street lights weren’t working during the week of Sept. 20.
Public Works discovered that copper wire that provides power to the lights had been stolen.
One theft occurred on Cathcart Way between 78th Avenue Southeast and State Route 9. The other occurred on Puget Park Drive between 67th Avenue Southeast and Cathcart Way at Willis Tucker Park.
No traffic lights were affected by the theft.
The Public Works Department is working to replace the wire and is asking for residents to be on the lookout for suspicious activity in their neighborhoods.
The Snohomish County Sheriff’s Office will be sending additional evening patrols to the areas where the thefts occurred and the county will be taking additional measures to secure the junction boxes that hold the wire.
Residents should expect repairs to be completed by Oct. 16.
Snohomish County residents who notice neighborhood street lights that appear to be malfunctioning may contact ROAD@snoco.org or call 425-388-ROAD (7623).
